(MENAFN- UkrinForm) The number of people in a Russian missile attack on Vilniansk, Zaporizhzhia region, has increased to 23, including eight children.
Ukraine's State Emergency Service announced this on , Ukrinform reports.
"As of 21:20, the number of those injured in the enemy attack has increased to 23, including eight children," the post reads.
The strike killed seven people, including two children.
On the afternoon of Saturday, June 29, Russian forces attacked Vilniansk, not far from Zaporizhzhia.

(MENAFN- UkrinForm) A Russian missile attack on Vilniansk, Zaporizhzhia region, has killed seven people, whereas the number of those has increased to 18, including four children.
"The Russian military struck the center of the city of Vilniansk, Zaporizhzhia region.
As of 20:15, seven people were killed, including two children.
According to Klymenko, thanks to the prompt response of the State Emergency Service, all fires were extinguished.
On the afternoon of Saturday, June 29, Russian forces attacked Vilniansk, not far from Zaporizhzhia.

Suicide bombing by the insurgents had stopped until yesterday’s incidents, which have fuelled fears that the reign of terror might have returned.
Saidu added that he also received a report that there was a suspected suicide bomber in Pulka.
He said: “The entire Gwoza council area is in serious mourning following multiple suicide attacks on our community.
An eyewitness, who simply identified himself as Musa, said on the phone that the first suicide bomber targeted a wedding ceremony.
However, the state Commissioner of Police (CP), Yusuf Lawal, who confirmed the attack on wedding ceremony to journalists in the state, stated that it was carried out by a female suicide bomber.

No fewer than six people have been killed with 15 others injured in a suicide attack in Gwoza, Borno.
Tragedy struck when the suicide bomber detonated an Improvised Explosive Device in Gwoza town.
Borno State Commissioner of Police, Yusuf Lawal, confirmed the attack saying that it was carried out by a female suicide bomber.
An eyewitness, who identified himself as Buba, told NAN that the suicide bomber targeted a wedding ceremony.
“The first explosion was at a wedding venue in Gwoza town.

Washington: US, European and Arab mediators are pressing to keep stepped-up cross-border attacks between Israel and Lebanon’s Iran-backed Hezbollah militants from spiralling into a wider Middle East war that the world has feared for months.
Iran and Israel traded threats on the weekend of what Iran said would be an “obliterating” war over Hezbollah.
A Lebanese family stands next to a destroyed building that were hit by an Israeli airstrike, in Aita al-Shaab, a border village.
Credit: APHopes are lagging for a ceasefire in Israel’s conflict with Hamas in Gaza that would calm attacks by Hezbollah and other Iranian-allied militias.
American and European diplomats and other officials are delivering warnings to Hezbollah – far stronger than Hamas but seen as overconfident – about taking on the military might of Israel, current and former diplomats say.

US and Europe warn Lebanon's Hezbollah to ease strikes on Israel and back off from wider Mideast warWASHINGTON (AP) — U.S., European and Arab mediators are pressing to keep stepped-up cross-border attacks between Israel and Lebanon's Iran-backed Hezbollah militants from spiraling into a wider Middle East war that the world has feared for months.
Iran and Israel traded threats Saturday of what Iran said would be an “obliterating” war over Hezbollah.
Beginning the day after Hamas' Oct. 7 attacks on Israel triggered the war in Gaza, Hezbollah has launched rockets into northern Israel and vowed to continue until a cease-fire takes hold.
Attacks intensified this month after Israel killed a top Hezbollah commander and Hezbollah responded with some of its biggest missile barrages.
Both Israel and Hezbollah, the dominant force in politically fractured Lebanon, have the power to cause heavy casualties.

U.S., European and Arab mediators are pressing to keep cross-border attacks between Israel and Lebanon’s Hezbollah terrorists from spiraling into a wider Middle East war.
On both sides of the Lebanese border, escalating strikes between Israel and Hezbollah, one of the region’s best-armed fighting forces, appeared at least to level off this past week.

Both Israel and Hezbollah, the dominant force in politically fractured Lebanon, have the power to cause heavy casualties.

Hopes are lagging for a cease-fire in Israel's conflict with Hamas in Gaza that would calm attacks by Hezbollah and other Iranian-allied militias.

By Nidal Al-MughrabiSunday June 30, 2024Smoke rises following an Israeli airstrike in the central Gaza Strip on Friday, March 15.
Abdel Kareem Hana/APA senior official of the militant Islamist group Hamas, Osama Hamdan, said on Saturday there has been no progress in ceasefire talks with Israel over the Gaza war.
The Israeli military on Saturday announced the death of two soldiers killed in combat in northern Gaza, as Israeli forces pressed on with an offensive in the Shejaia neighborhood in Gaza City.
The armed wing of Hamas and the allied Islamic Jihad reported fierce fighting, saying fighters fired anti-tank rockets and mortar bombs against the forces operating there.
Israel has said its military operations in Rafah are aimed at eradicating the last armed battalions of Hamas.

PHOTO: REUTERSA senior official of the militant Islamist group Hamas, Osama Hamdan, said on Saturday there has been no progress in ceasefire talks with Israel over the Gaza war.
Hamas says any deal must end the war and bring full Israeli withdrawal from Gaza, while Israel says it will accept only temporary pauses in fighting until Hamas, which has ruled Gaza since 2007, is eradicated.
Israel has lost more than 300 soldiers in Gaza and says at least a third of the Palestinian dead are fighters.
The Israeli military on Saturday announced the death of two soldiers killed in combat in northern Gaza, as Israeli forces pressed on with an offensive in the Shejaia neighborhood in Gaza City.
Israel has said its military operations in Rafah are aimed at eradicating the last armed battalions of Hamas.

Open this photo in gallery: Hamas official Osama Hamdan speaks during a press conference, amid the ongoing conflict between Israel and Hamas, in Beirut, Lebanon on May 27, 2024.Mohamed Azakir/ReutersA senior official of the militant Islamist group Hamas, Osama Hamdan, said on Saturday there has been no progress in ceasefire talks with Israel over the Gaza war.
The Palestinian group is still ready to “deal positively” with any ceasefire proposal that ends the war, Hamdan told a news conference in Beirut.
Hamas says any deal must end the war and bring full Israeli withdrawal from Gaza, while Israel says it will accept only temporary pauses in fighting until Hamas, which has ruled Gaza since 2007, is eradicated.
The Israeli military on Saturday announced the death of two soldiers killed in combat in northern Gaza, as Israeli forces pressed on with an offensive in the Shejaia neighborhood in Gaza City.
Israel has said its military operations in Rafah are aimed at eradicating the last armed battalions of Hamas.

(AP Photo/Evgeniy Maloletka) (AP Photo/Evgeniy Maloletka)KYIV, Ukraine — Russian attacks across eastern Ukraine killed at least 11 people Saturday, while rescuers in the city of Dnipro dug through rubble after a Russian strike ripped through a nine-story residential building, leaving one dead, officials said.
The attacks came as Russia continues to stretch out Ukrainian forces in several areas along the 1,000-kilometer (600-mile) front.
He said that Russian forces had shelled populated areas 13 times over the past 24 hours.
Meanwhile, in Dnipro, at least one person died and 12 were wounded, including a 7-month-old girl, after a Russian strike destroyed the top four floors of the apartment building on Friday evening, regional head Serhii Lysak said.
Russian officials also reported Ukrainian attacks, with a drone strike killing five people in Russia’s Kursk region, local officials said Saturday.

KYIV, Ukraine -- Russian attacks across eastern Ukraine killed at least 11 people Saturday, while rescuers in the city of Dnipro dug through rubble after a Russian strike ripped through a nine-story residential building, leaving one dead, officials said.
The attacks came as Russia continues to stretch out Ukrainian forces in several areas along the 600-mile front.
The shelling of the front-line village of Niu-York in the Donetsk region also wounded five people, Gov.
He said Russian forces had shelled populated areas 13 times over the past 24 hours.
A further seven people were killed Saturday afternoon in Russian shelling on the town of Vilniansk, including two children, Gov.

He said that Russian forces had shelled populated areas 13 times over the past 24 hours.
Meanwhile, in Dnipro, at least one person died and 12 were injured, including a 7-month-old girl, after a Russian strike destroyed the top four floors of the apartment bloc Friday evening, said regional head Serhii Lysak.
Russian officials also reported Ukrainian attacks, with a drone strike killing five people in Russia’s Kursk region, local officials said on Saturday.
A Ukrainian drone strike killed at least five people in Russia’s Kursk region, local officials said on Saturday.

KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — A Ukrainian drone strike killed at least five people in Russia's Kursk region, local officials said Saturday, while rescuers in the Ukrainian city of Dnipro dug through rubble after a Russian attack ripped through a nine-story residential building, leaving one dead.
Two children were among the victims of the Ukranian attack in the village of Gorodishche on the Russian-Ukrainian border, Gov.
In Dnipro, at least one person died and 12 were injured, including a 7-month-old girl, after a Russian strike destroyed the top four floors of the apartment bloc Friday evening, regional head Serhii Lysak said.
Discussing the attack in Dnipro, Zelenskyy said it was a reminder to Ukraine’s allies that the country needed more air defense systems.
The Ukrainian air force said Saturday that it had downed 10 Russian drones overnight.

An attacker with a crossbow wounded a Serbian police officer guarding the Israeli Embassy in Belgrade on Saturday, Serbia 's Interior Ministry said.
Police officers block off traffic at an intersection close to the Israeli embassy in Belgrade in Serbia on Saturday, June 29.
(AP)Interior Minister Ivica Dacic said in a statement that the attacker fired a bolt at the officer, hitting him in the neck.
Israel's ambassador to Belgrade, Yahel Vilan, said he was deeply shocked "by the terrorist attack" in front of the embassy.
Because there is no other motive why someone would attack a gendarme outside the Israeli Embassy."

Open this photo in gallery: Police officers block off traffic at an intersection close to the Israeli embassy in Belgrade, Serbia, Saturday, June 29, 2024.
An attacker with a crossbow wounded a Serbian police officer guarding the Israeli Embassy in Belgrade.
Serbia’s interior ministry says the officer responded by fatally shooting the assailant.Marko Drobnjakovic/The Associated PressAn attacker with a crossbow wounded a Serbian police officer guarding the Israeli Embassy in Belgrade on Saturday, Serbia’s Interior Ministry said.
Serbia’s populist President Aleksandar Vucic visited the wounded officer in the hospital, promising a sweeping crackdown against “terrorists.”“We are hunting them down,” he said.
Israel’s ambassador to Belgrade, Yahel Vilan, said he was deeply shocked “by the terrorist attack” in front of the embassy.

BELGRADE, Serbia—An attacker with a crossbow wounded a Serbian police officer guarding the Israeli Embassy in Belgrade on Saturday, Serbia’s Interior Ministry said.
Both Serbian and Israeli officials said initial indications pointed to terrorism as a motive.
Interior Minister Ivica Dacic said in a statement that the attacker fired a bolt at the officer, hitting him in the neck.
Israel’s ambassador to Belgrade, Yahel Vilan, said he was deeply shocked “by the terrorist attack” in front of the embassy.
Israel’s embassy is located not far from the U.S. Embassy in an upscale Belgrade district.

Moscow's defense ministry on June 30 claimed to have destroyed 36 Ukrainian drones overnight that targeted several regions in the southwest of Russia.
The defense ministry did not provide details of any damage or casualties caused.
The Kyiv Independent could not verify the claims.
Ukrainian drones have struck targets in Russia as far as the Tatarstan Republic, some 1,200 kilometers (750 miles) away from the Russia-Ukraine border.
Consider supporting the Kyiv Independent.

Ukraine now mass-producing strike drones with range of over 1,000 kilometersUkraine has launched serial production of strike drones with a range of over 1,000 kilometers, the head of state-owned company Ukrainian Defense Industry, also known as Ukroboronprom, said on June 29.
Ukraine employs long-range drones to strike deep into Russian territory, targeting military infrastructure such as airfields and logistics, as well as oil refineries and depots.
Experimental Ukrainian drones have struck targets in Russia as far as the Tatarstan Republic, some 1,200 kilometers (750 miles) away from the Russia-Ukraine border.
Smetanin said that with the help of "private individuals," Ukrainian Defense Industry was now able to "scale production" of long-range drones.
Moscow's defense ministry on June 30 claimed to have destroyed 36 Ukrainian drones overnight that targeted several regions in the southwest of Russia.

One dead, five injured in France wedding hall attackPolice officers are at work on the site of a shooting that took place overnight during a wedding party in Thionville, northeastern France (Jean-Christophe VERHAEGEN)One person was killed and five others wounded in northeastern France when several masked gunmen opened fire at a wedding ceremony, police sources said on Sunday.
Sources suggested that the attack in the northeastern city of Thionville was linked to a settling of scores between drug traffickers.
The shooting took place at a reception hall overnight Saturday to Sunday, with around a hundred people in attendance.
"The wedding was not targeted as such, it was people who were at the wedding," the source said.

Police officers are at work on the site of a shooting that occured overnight during a wedding party in Thionville, eastern France - AFPOne person was killed and five others wounded in northeastern France when several masked gunmen opened fire at a wedding ceremony, police sources said on Sunday.
Sources suggested that the attack in the northeastern city of Thionville was linked to a settling of scores between drug traffickers.
The shooting took place at a reception hall overnight Saturday to Sunday, with around a hundred people in attendance.
A glass door pierced with bullet holes could be seen at the scene on Sunday morning - AFP“It was during a wedding,” a police source said.
“The wedding was not targeted as such, it was people who were at the wedding,” the source said.

Fears of a full-blown war grew this month after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Israel was preparing for“a very tense operation” on the border with Lebanon.
Israeli forces conducted a series of attacks on Hezbollah targets in southern Lebanon, an Israeli army spokesperson said early on Saturday.
Gallant said this week in the United States that Israel was“preparing for every scenario”.
“Hezbollah understands very well that we can inflict massive damage in Lebanon if a war is launched,” he said in Washington, DC.
Amid the growing tensions, several countries, including Germany, Canada, the Netherlands and the United States, have urged their nationals to leave or avoid travel to Lebanon.

(You can now subscribe to our(You can now subscribe to our Economic Times WhatsApp channelIsraeli troops continued pressing military operations against Hamas in northern Gaza 's Shejaya area, the Israel Defence Forces said on Sunday.Over the past day, the troops eliminated several terrorists , located weapons, and conducted targeted raids on booby-trapped combat compounds.
The Air Force also struck dozens of Hamas infrastructure sites.Dozens of Hamas terrorists were killed in close-quarters combat and airstrikes and several tunnel shafts were dismantled over the weekend.Soldiers encircled a civilian area in Shejaya that Hamas converted into a compound.
Troops located observation posts, weapons, aerial drones and a long-range rocket launcher near Shejaya schools.Elsewhere in Gaza, Israeli forces struck and dismantled a mortar post located inside a tunnel shaft in the southern Gaza town of Rafah.At least 1,200 people were killed, and 252 Israelis and foreigners were taken hostage in Hamas's attacks on Israeli communities near the Gaza border on October 7.
Of the 116 remaining hostages, more than 30 are believed dead.

Over the past day, the troops eliminated several terrorists, located weapons, and conducted targeted raids on booby-trapped combat compounds.

Elsewhere in Gaza, Israeli forces struck and dismantled a mortar post located inside a tunnel shaft in the southern Gaza town of Rafah.

Heavy battles and bombardment hit Gaza City's Shujaiya district for a fourth day on Sunday, months after the Israeli army declared Hamas's command structure dismantled in the northern area.
It also reported clashes in central Gaza and the southern Rafah area, a week after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu declared that the "intense phase" of the war raging since October 7 was nearing an end.
The United Nations humanitarian agency OCHA estimated that "60,000 to 80,000 people were displaced" from Shujaiya since new fighting broke out there on Thursday and the army issued evacuation orders.
The militants also seized 251 hostages, 116 of whom remain in Gaza although the army says 42 are dead.
Israel's retaliatory offensive has killed at least 37,877 people, also mostly civilians, according to data from the health ministry in Hamas-run Gaza.

GAZA: Heavy battles and bombardment hit Gaza City's Shujaiya district for a fourth day on Sunday, months after the Israeli army declared Palestinian groups command structure dismantled in the northern area.
Tens of thousands of Palestinians have fled the devastated neighbourhood, where the army said it has fought Palestinian groups both "above and below ground" in tunnels.
The war started with October 7 attack on southern Israel which resulted in the deaths of 1,195 people, based on Israeli figures.
The Palestinian groups seized 251 captives, 116 of whom remain in Gaza although the army says 42 are dead.
Israel's retaliatory offensive has killed at least 37,877 people, mostly civilians, according to data from the health ministry in Gaza.

A former Chief of Defence Staff, Adm. Ibrahim Ogohi, has passed on after a brief illness at the age of 75.
In a brief statement by the Acting Director, Defence Information, Brig.-Gen. Tukur Gusau, on Sunday, the former defence chief died in the early hours of Sunday, at his Abuja home.
He was the defence chief between 1999 and 2003, and was the first Nigerian Navy officer to attain a four-star general rank.
“With deep sorrow, I announce the death of Admiral Ibrahim Ogohi (rtd), a former Chief of Defence Staff (1999-2003).
In 1992, he was Directing Staff in the National War College, and Deputy Commandant, Armed Forces Command Staff College, Jaji in 1995.

Former Nigeria’s Defence Chief, Admiral Ibrahim Ogohi Dies At 75(AFRICAN EXAMINER) – A former Chief of Defence Staff, Adm. Ibrahim Ogohi, has passed on after a brief illness at the age of 75.
He was the defence chief between 1999 and 2003, and was the first Nigerian Navy officer to attain a four-star general rank.
“With deep sorrow, I announce the death of Admiral Ibrahim Ogohi (rtd), a former Chief of Defence Staff (1999-2003).
In 1992, he was Directing Staff in the National War College, and Deputy Commandant, Armed Forces Command Staff College, Jaji in 1995.
In May 1999, he was appointed Chief of Defence Staff till 2003.

Israeli airstrike in the northern West Bank kills a Palestinian militant and wounds 5 other peopleNUR SHAMS REFUGEE CAMP, West Bank (AP) — Israeli troops carried out an airstrike in the northern West Bank on Sunday, killing a Palestinian militant and wounding five other people, Palestinian health officials said.
The Israeli military confirmed an attack on the home, saying that militants inside, including al-Jaber, were responsible for recent attacks on Israeli targets.
The Palestinian Health Ministry says over 500 Palestinians have been killed by Israeli fire in the West Bank since the start of the war.
Israeli forces have been battling Palestinian militants in an eastern part of Gaza City, Shijaiyah, in recent days.
The Israeli military said an explosive drone launched by Hezbollah crashed into the Golan Heights on Sunday, severely wounding a soldier and lightly hurting 17 others.

Palestinian health officials said one person was killed and several wounded during an Israeli operation in the Nur Shams refugee camp in the northern West Bank.
Israel frequently operates in the area, saying it is a stronghold of Palestinian militants.
(AP Photo/Majdi Mohammed)NUR SHAMS REFUGEE CAMP, West Bank (AP) — Israeli troops carried out an airstrike in the northern West Bank on Sunday, killing a Palestinian militant and wounding five other people, Palestinian health officials said.
The occupied West Bank has experienced a surge in violence since the war in Gaza erupted in October.
The Palestinian Health Ministry says over 500 Palestinians have been killed by Israeli fire in the West Bank since the start of the war.

NUR SHAMS REFUGEE CAMP, West Bank (AP) — Israeli troops carried out an airstrike in the northern West Bank on Sunday, killing a Palestinian militant and wounding five other people, Palestinian health officials said.
The strike took place in Nur Shams, an urban refugee camp that has been a frequent target of the Israeli military and is known as a stronghold of Palestinian militants.
The Israeli military confirmed an attack on the home, saying that militants inside, including al-Jaber, were responsible for recent attacks on Israeli targets.
The Palestinian Health Ministry says over 500 Palestinians have been killed by Israeli fire in the West Bank since the start of the war.
Israeli forces have been battling Palestinian militants in an eastern part of Gaza City, Shijaiyah, in recent days.

messages.message:
The Chief of Defence Staff (CDS), General Christopher Musa, has said the late Admiral Ibrahim Ogohi, 8th Chief of Defence Staff of Nigeria from 1999-2003, was patriotic to the end.
Admiral Ogohi, who hails from Kogi State, was born in Lafia, Dekina local government area of the State, on November 14, 1948.
He enrolled into the Nigerian Defence Academy (NDA) Kaduna as a member of 4th Regular Course in 1967 and was commissioned into the Nigerian Navy in 1970.
Admiral Ogohi started his military training as a Midshipman in the United Kingdom in 1971 and attended the Sub-Lieutenant Technical Course in India in 1972.
The late Admiral Ogohi held several appointments in the Nigerian Navy, including: Commanding Officer, Nigerian Navy Ship YOLA – 1976 – 1977; Commanding Officer, Nigerian Navy Ships OTOBO and DORINA – 1980, and Commanding Officer, Nigerian Navy Ship EKUN – 1982.

Ikechukwu Aleke in AbujaThe Military High Command, Sunday expressed grief over the passing of the former Chief of Defence Staff (1999-2003), Admiral Ibrahim Ogohi.
In 1967, he enrolled into the Nigerian Defence Academy Kaduna as a member of 4th Regular Course and was commissioned into the Nigerian Navy in 1970.
The late Admiral held several appointments in the Nigerian Navy including: Commanding Officer Nigerian Navy Ship YOLA – 1976 – 1977.
Commanding Officer Nigerian Navy Ships OTOBO and DORINA – 1980.
Commanding Officer Nigerian Navy Ship EKUN – 1982.
Palestinian sources: The house that was attacked in the Nur Shams refugee camp in Tulkarm is the home of Abu Shuhjaa 👆, commander of the Tulkarm Battalion. It was attacked with three missiles.

Sources affiliated with Fatah report that Saeed al-Jaber was killed in a fighter jet attack on the Nur Shams refugee camp in Tulkarm.
According to these sources, Abu Shuhjaa, the commander of the Tulkarm battalion, is still alive.

3793bd53-1adf-498a-a367-d18d8ae3cacd.location: Nur Shams refugee camp in Tulkarm
